definition: decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: My song has put off her adornments . She has no pride of dress and decoration.
sentences.chinese: 我的诗歌卸掉妆饰，她没有衣饰的骄傲。

sentences.english: There was a self-possessed young lady connected with these accessories;
sentences.chinese: 穿戴这些衣饰的是一个沉着镇定的年轻女子。

sentences.english: She chose the most splendid gown she had, and took out her jewels.
sentences.chinese: 她从衣饰中选出最华丽的一件长衫，取出她的珠宝。

sentences.english: I never in my life saw anything more elegant than their dresses.
sentences.chinese: 我生平没有看见过任何东西比她们的衣饰更讲究。

sentences.english: The second chapter discusses the vicissitude of civil official dress system .
sentences.chinese: 第二章论述清代文官衣饰制度的变迁。

sentences.english: Suri and her latest outfit are now a favorite subject for the paparazzi.
sentences.chinese: 苏里和她最新衣饰都是狗仔队跟拍的主题。

sentences.english: People in political circles and business circles spend much time on clothing, they have good manners.
sentences.chinese: 政界和工商界人士普遍衣饰讲究，言行举止规矩大方。

sentences.english: The 4-year-old altered and put her own outfits together.
sentences.chinese: 四岁的她修改并搭配自己的衣饰。

sentences.english: I never in my life saw any thing more elegant than their dresses. I dare say the lace upon Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 我生平没有看见过任何东西比她们的衣饰更讲究。

sentences.english: Is but the seemly raiment of my heart.
sentences.chinese: 是我心衣饰的得体仪容。

sentences.english: I never in my life saw any thing more elegant than their dresses.
sentences.chinese: 我生平没有看见过任何东西比她们的衣饰更讲究。
